Title: Requires insurers which issue contracts providing long term care benefits to maintain records of policies cancelled due to increased premiums
Summary: Requires insurers which issue contracts providing long term care benefits to maintain records of policies cancelled during each year and requires that such records indicate which policies were cancelled due to, or within thirty days after, an increase in policy premiums.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to health insurance plans for long term care
